title: Conditions
question: This code will print "Success" – true or false?
hint: else blocks are executed if the condition is false, and Swift won't let you compare different types of data.

correct.reason: This will print "Success" because age is over 18.
This will print "Success" because name is not "Paul".
This will print "Success" because orderAmount is equal to 200.
This will print "Success" because city is not "Madrid".
This will print "Success" because employeeCount is equal to 50.
This will print "Success" because teaStrength is over 4.

wrong.reason: sharkCount is equal to 21, so this will print "Failure".
passwordLength is equal to 5, so this will print "Failure".
isAvailable is false, so this will print "Failure".
This attempts to compare an integer to a double, which is invalid.
Strings are case-sensitive, so comparing "Red" to "red" will fail.
This attempts to compare a string and an integer, which is invalid.
